title: ’Brain rot‘ named Oxford Word of the Year 2024
dot:
digraph OxfordWordOfTheYear{graph[rankdir=TB];node[shape=box, style=rounded]; A[label="Oxford Word of the Year 2024: 'brain rot'" fontcolor=black style=bold];B[label="Definition
Deterioration of mental state due to trivial online content"];C[label="Public Voting
37,000 participants"];D[label="Usage Increase
230% since 2023"];E[label="Cultural Significance

title: Fish have a brain microbiome – could humans have one too?
dot: digraph BrainMicrobiome{node[shape=box, style=rounded, fontsize=10];A[label="Main Idea: Potential Existence of Microbial Brains in Humans"]; B[label="Introduction"];C[label="Bacteria are ubiquitous in the environment"];D[label="Long assumption: Bacteria can't survive in the human brain"];E[label="Blood-brain barrier keeps brain free from invaders"];F[label="Conflicting evidence on human brain microbiome"]; G[label="Recent Study: Evidence of Brain Microbiome in Fish"];H[label="Bacteria found in salmon and trout brains"];I[label="Special adaptations allow survival in brain tissue"];J[label="Microbes can cross the blood-brain barrier"];K[label="Skepticism About Human Brain Microbiome"];L[label="Fish physiology similar to humans, but key differences exist"];M[label="Gut-brain axis connects gut microbiome to brain function"]; N[label="Research Process: Salinas' Study"];O[label="Extracted DNA from fish olfactory bulbs"];P[label="Ensured samples were uncontaminated"];Q[label="Confirmed living bacteria in the brain"];R[label="Mechanisms of Microbial Presence in Brains"];S[label="Microbes may cross barrier during early development"];T[label="Some bacteria may leak from blood/gut into brain"];U[label="Microbes could regulate physiological processes"];V[label="Future Research: Implications for Humans"];W[label="Possibility of brain microbiomes in rodents and humans"];X[label="Microbes could influence brain metabolism and immune systems"];A->B;B->C;B->D;B->E;B->F;A->G;G->H;G->I;G->J;A->K;K->L;K->M;A->N;N->O;N->P;N->Q;A->R;R->S;R->T;R->U;A->V;V->W;V->X;label="Brain Microbiome Research Overview";rankdir=LR;}
